headline: Easily the best.
reviewBody: I'd highly recommend this agency to anybody no matter your situation or background mainly due to my advisor, Natalie Payne. She was especially helpful when I had to withdraw from my original application due to a family bereavement and gave me the time to recover and land the next one I applied for. Thanks Natalie!

headline: Amazing help!
reviewBody:
Amazing help in finding an apprenticeship. Supportive, nice to talk to, and a good experience overall.

Special mention to Nathalie Payne who helped me and was great!

headline: I can‚Äôt put into words how helpful QA‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I can‚Äôt put into words how helpful QA were, in particular Nathalie Payne in helping me build a career by successfully applying for a fantastic opportunity.

Nathalie was incredibly helpful and kind throughout the whole process and I have had nothing but positive experience‚Äôs from the get go.

headline: QA gave outstanding support to help me land my dream job.
reviewBody: QA were extremely helpful in helping me secure a business analyst apprenticeship. In particular, Nathalie Payne went above and beyond to make sure I had all the information and preparation I needed to be a successful candidate for the role I was applying for. I couldn‚Äôt of asked for a better person to help me land this amazing opportunity as Nathalie guided me through the whole application and interview process. Nathalie is a credit to QA and has gave me an extremely positive experience with QA üëçüèº

headline: thanks for the help
reviewBody: Got a job very easily, thank you for the help

headline: Looking forward to a new start
reviewBody:
Like many people during these difficult times, I decided that it was time to reskill and applied for a few apprenticeships.  I came across the IT infrastructure and Networking apprenticeship, applied and was surprised to get a call from them 2 days later.  It is safe to say that I was quite impressed with Helen Anthony from the recruitment team.  She was very welcoming, professional and managed to secure me an interview.  As well as sending me preparation material, she also called me the day before my interview to give me extremely helpful advice which made a big difference.  I will be starting my apprenticeship next month and would like to thank Helen and QA for this opportunity.  I will post again in the future with a review of the apprenticeship course.

Kind regards

headline: Professional. Efficient. Amazing
reviewBody: I applied for a role and within an hour I received a call to further the application and get things rolling with the employer. Through the whole process I was looked after by Helen Antony. She was incredible all through the recruitment process. Any questions I had were answered to the best of her ability and she always went that extra mile to support me and guide me where possible. Couldn't of asked for me really. Honestly, some of the best service I've ever received. Thank you Helen for all your hard work.

headline: Unprofessional and unresponsive!
reviewBody:
I would avoid any dealing with QA Ltd due to the fact that they are very unprofessional. I applied for an apprenticeship and got to the final stage near two months ago and have been ghosted since. I've asked numerous times for updates and ignored. Only emails I've had since is to rate them highly on how their assessment center went. Even contacted a fellow candidate who hasn't heard back either!

Strange how you can email wanting a review but can't get back to your final stage candidates with any updates. This was a role i was very excited for, now not so much.

headline: QA apprenticeships
reviewBody:
I had a pleasant experience of meeting Helen, who guided me through and helped me prepare¬†for an interview for a job to then hopefully leading on to me having a opportunity of being part of an apprenticeship.

I've spoken too many people from the QA team however I am very glad I came across Helen as she went the extra mile.¬†

I would like to let you know you have a very helpful team member and I appreciate the time and effort Helen has given me.

headline: Helen Anthony QA
reviewBody:
Helen was an amazing Recruiter, the best recruiter I have spoken to.
Helen went above and beyond for me during the hiring process, Helen was there to answer all my questions and to give me advice on what I needed to make me successful throughout the interviews.
I couldn't ask for a better recruiter. 

If it wasn‚Äôt for Helen I wouldn‚Äôt have stepped into my dream job.
So thank you!

headline: Waste of time
reviewBody: I had spent a lot time sending them various stuff they need by email and scanning stuff. Then got an email saying I had an interview told me the day but not the time and company and then disappeared

headline: Osman Najib at QA
reviewBody:
Fantastic Recruiter, in fact the best of the best. Osman consistently went above and beyond for me during the hiring process, he did everything he could to make me successful through the application and the interview stage. I couldn't ask for a better recruiter. I have been in touch with many providers and recruiters and Osman was by far the BEST! 

Thank you for helping me achieve my dream!

headline: Absolutely appalling
reviewBody:
Absolutely appalling. 

I have an exam on Friday and none of my learning materials are accessible as QA's eLearning has been built using flash player. Having done some research flash player is now obsolete, so it won't play in any device or browser!

I phoned QA yesterday afternoon to tell them there was a problem and was told someone would be in touch. 24 hours have now passed and not one person has contacted me since. I've been chasing for the last day without any resolution whatsoever.

Today I contacted them via chat, they said they had no record of my booking and told me to speak to cloud learning. I called QA again and they told me to call someone else on their personal number. I called the person in question 3 times and each time my call was ignored.

I then called the IT line and they told me to call yet another person. I call said person and they won't answer either. I then get passed through to the main switchboard again and after putting me on hold for 10 minutes, they tell me to call the person I just tried to call and isn't answering!

I'm now on a call again to them. The main switchboard passed me to their coursework team, the coursework team then tell me the course is in my eLearning and I'm clicking on the wrong course. I'm not! The one they're referring to which they claim is my eLearning is supplementary learning with 7 updated pieces of information because the course has changed slightly since the course was first issued to me. My course has over 25 modules and I don't have access to any of them!

It shouldn't be this incredibly difficult for an issue like this to be fixed. No one at QA wants to take ownership of the issue or fix with it any urgency, despite having an exam set for 3 days time! Everyone just keeps passing the buck on to someone else or ignoring your calls! 

A new link to the module should have been proactively sent to me before flash player even became obsolete! It shouldn't be up to the candidate to continually beg for days for a new link to be sent so that I can continue to do the learning that my employer has already paid for me to have access to!

EDIT: Sophia - 9301698. This number has been given to 6 different members of staff so far. I look forward to someone finally taking ownership of this situation and resolving the problem by the end of today. I'm utterly sick of this now.

headline: AMAZING EXPERIENCE
reviewBody:
Nathalie Payne at QA helped me secure my first IT role with an amazing company. She was really helpful prepping me for the interview and was in contact all the way through. Working in recruitment previously, it‚Äôs so refreshing to see a consultant understand what you are looking for and making you feel like she‚Äôs on your side! 
Can‚Äôt recommend enough!

headline: Excellent
reviewBody: Radhika Mehra helped me to secure an apprenticeship place. She was very helpful and provided advice and guidance. She has also offered ongoing assistance as required.

headline: Helen Anthony at QA‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I was contacted by Helen Anthony at QA about an apprentice opportunity near me and set up with an interview with her to talk to me further about the role. From there, she assisted setting up two further interviews with the employer which Helen helped me feel prepared for. She was always available to help when I needed it and guiding me every step of the way! A month after her first email to me I was offered the position and have now began my apprenticeship and couldn‚Äôt be happier.

headline: With the help of Monish Patel I was‚Ä¶
reviewBody: With the help of Monish Patel I was able to secure my apprenticeship.

headline: Great experience, very helpful, responsive and informative
reviewBody: I applied for an apprenticeship earlier this year in the IT sector through QA and have had a great experience. I was soon after contacted by Aaron Annesley who helped guide me through all the processes and went above and beyond to ultimately assist me in achieving an offer for the job/apprenticeship which I have accepted. I have not yet started the new position, however if the support and responsiveness I have received so far is anything to go on, I am confident I have made the right choice.

headline: I had Arfan guiding me through the‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I had Arfan guiding me through the apprenticeship application progress, he was great as well as all the other team members that helped me. Very good at helping you through the process!

headline: great work helped me with everything i‚Ä¶
reviewBody: great work helped me with everything i needed

headline: So far so good with my apprenticeship
reviewBody: So far so good with my apprenticeship. Besides the disappointing pay, I'm enjoying my apprenticeship with my employer. I feel supported all the way through and I hope the rest of the 12-15 months will be just as good as it has started. Thank you Pakeeza for helping me land this apprenticeship :D

headline: Apprentice secured! Thanks Radhika
reviewBody: With the struggles of COVID i finally secured a job thanks to Radhika at QA. I filled out the form and she contacted me to fill in a bit more info and got an interview. Kept me up to date the hole journey with feedback and always positive and giving advise. Highly recommend.

headline: I was contacted by Mo Patel regarding a‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I was contacted by Mo Patel regarding a role, although I did not get the role Mo constantly kept me updated with what was going on and always reassured me with positivity. He is a real asset to QA and needs to be recognised for his hard work!

headline: I secured my apprenticeship!!
reviewBody: I secured my apprenticeship through QA :) the process was very smooth sailing and quick. Mo guided me through the interview process and explained to me what to expect so I could prepare myself. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for an apprenticeship programme!

headline: The QA team have been excellent
reviewBody: The QA team have been excellent. All the way through the process they have remain actively in contact and supportive. Giving brilliant advise and feed back in the lead up to the apprenticeship interview.

headline: Very friendly and amazing
reviewBody: With great help from Aaron Annesley, I had successfully got the role I applied for, and was supported all along the way by Aaron, keep up to good work!

headline: Tech Support
reviewBody: I was hoping to land a role in Tech Support. Although it didnt go as planned, but the support and guidance offered by Helen was really helpful.

headline: Supportive and helpful each step of the way!
reviewBody:
I am very pleased from my experience with QA, thanks to Nusaybah Ali, who through all her effort, support and advice, helped me achieve my Data Analyst Apprentice position. She was always readily available to provide feedback, advice or assistance, and was involved during the application and interview processes at its every step.

QA are very dedicated to their learners' progression, and it is made enjoyable as well as challenging. The trainers at QA are also appreciated, with special thanks to my trainer, Michael Brightman, who constantly provides prompt responses to any query. 

All in all, the team at QA provide an excellent service, are genuine and truly want to provide you with amazing opportunities.

headline: Supportive Team!
reviewBody:
QA have been very supportive of me and my learning from the very beginning. From the initial phone call with Arfan, I felt that I was being taken seriously and guided properly before the interview stage, during and after. 

Upon accepting the apprenticeship, QA has been brilliant at facilitating learners so far. I always get prompt replies and I'm currently happy with the service I've received as a Digital Marketing Apprentice.

headline: The best apprenticeship provider for Tech Apprentices
reviewBody:
Second apprenticeship with QA and they are literally amazing.

Mo Patel who helped me along the way was amazing!

Sound and quality feedback given after each interview.

Help you each step along the way. Wayyyy better then Just IT - I was left for 3 weeks without any response after my interview. QA informed me under a week!

Hope this helps someone.

headline: Excellent Treatment
reviewBody: I have been very pleased with the treatment I have received from Nusaybah at QA. Everything has been explained to be well and there were no problems throughout the whole  process of me doing an apprenticeship. I highly recommend.

headline: QA is a great Team of Professionals
reviewBody: I am an experienced professional working in Retail for many years, I decided to Foray into the IT domain and my experience with QA resourcing team was top notch. The resourcing team was prompt and effective with their actions to set things in motion. Specifically Radhika Mehra, who has been exceptional. She has been instrumental in getting me to my destination of choice. I firmly believe that QA is a wonderful team of experienced professionals. In my experience, Radhika's candidate management is immaculate, the quality of advice was excellent and everything was very well organized. In my years of working, across different companies, I have found QA a very competent and  professional team and, would certainly recommend Radhika Mehra. Thank you and Best Wishes to entire QA Team, Rajat Handa

headline: I was contacted by Pakeeza from the QA‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I was contacted by Pakeeza from the QA team regarding my apprenticeship. Have not actually begun the apprenticeship yet,  however so far I have been very satisfied with the treatment I have received. All inquiries have been dealt with well and explained clearly to me, she has always been very polite and friendly whenever we interact.  I highly recommend.

headline: I found an apprenticeship through QA.
reviewBody:
I found an apprenticeship through QA.
My experience was made very smooth and enjoyable by the incredibly polite and helpful recruiter Radhika.

headline: Excellent communication
reviewBody: Excellent communication, and gave us 3 very strong candidates, all of which we wanted to employ. Thank you for your diligence and for picking the right people.

headline: The worst training provider ever
reviewBody: The worst training provider ever. I studied and finished an engineering degree with the OU. I was working in IT and was put on an apprenticeship with QA. Changed dates without informing me, pushed for work I couldn‚Äôt do under current restrictions. Threatened to fail me if I didn‚Äôt do the work within a deadline. A lot of the questions in the exams are not provided in the training material.

headline: Excellent customer service - highly recommended
reviewBody: I was contacted by Radhika about an apprenticeship and she's been extremely helpful throughout the process, I couldn't ask for more from the early stages to when I received a formal job offer & contract. She's a real asset to QA and one of the best recruiters I have met - thank you again for finding me this great company and opportunity.

headline: Amazing Help!
reviewBody: I had started looking for an apprenticeship earlier this year and have had a bit of trouble starting out, but i recently got in contact with someone at QA called Helen Anthony, who helped guide me and give me tips. This ultimately helped me land a role in the IT sector. I really apreciate all the help she has given and i don't think i could have done it without her.

headline: Began applying for apprenticeships and‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Began applying for apprenticeships and after applying through QA I have been in constant contact with a recruiter. Helen Anthony has coached me through the entire process, keeping me up to date and even giving me some prep just before the interview! I am constantly blown away by the work put in. Only a positive experience from me.

headline: Avoid at all cost
reviewBody:
Terrible training materials, you're basically on your own.
The exercises (hands on lab) they give you are literally copy and paste (I am not kidding), copy and past this in the IDE and then see what it does.
The CloudAcademy library is complete trash, you watch videos of people reading stuff at you, no pedagogical approach, you end up searching for other websites on internet to learn because everything else is better than what they offer. Then you have a training session once every 3 months, which is fully packed with content and that the teacher rushes to finishes because he doesn't have much time (in 5 days we "learned" Python and SQL), you are with 12 other students in the training so you won't have time to ask much question as it needs to move on. Avoid at all cost!
If you don't want to waste your time, energy and money go somewhere else!

edit: QA tried to have my review deleted even though from how accurate it is they knew it wasn't a fake review.
You can be sure they are not trying to having those good reviews deleted. Therefore the scoring is not really representative of what it should really be, I'm sure many reviews were deleted because they didn't like them.

edit2: The more the time goes the more I realize how much of a waste of my time that thing is, I just lost an entire year and missed on serious job opportunities thanks to QA . Talked to my dlc about it he basically doesn't care, they got the money from the government, + all those suspect positive reviews (a lot came after my review surprisingly well timed to keep the score up). It's basically a scam.

headline: Outstanding
reviewBody:
Outstanding! I am an experienced recruiter working in the IT MSP sector and have been dealing with training providers for many a year. 

To say that I'm disappointed by 9/10 of the providers in this space I have dealt with would be an understatement. That is certainly not the case with QA and more specifically with Helen Anthony who has been exceptional. Her candidate management was first class, the quality of candidate was excellent and was very organised.  In my 12 years I have not come across a more competent Training Provider and would not hesitate in recommending Helen to the wider market. Keep up the good work! - Scott Banford, Alphascan

headline: Apprenticeship help
reviewBody: While searching for a career switch I began applying for apprenticeships and Helen Anthony contacted me and guided me through the process, she was absolutely amazing in arranging the interviews and giving me pointers, she even contacted me a few hours before to go over my preparation and tweak it for the best result, could ask for a better person.

headline: Highly Recommend
reviewBody: Was applying for jobs and found job through QA. Very quick turnaround with punctual replies to emails and explaining every step of the process with helpful tips for interviewing. Answered every question I had and made job hunting an enjoyable experience.

headline: Delayed exam results. Terrible customer service.
reviewBody: BCS Business Analysis Practitioner Certificate classroom course & exam. Course OK, typical mass produced training, delivered with the sole aim of passing the exam and avoiding any broader discussion of the topic: 3*. Exam results delayed by ~5 weeks as QA left them in an unstaffed office (blamed Covid): -1*. Exam admin team poor at responding to emails and it's utterly impossible to speak to anyone right up until you publish a negative review.

headline: I am not someone who typical writes‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I am not someone who typical writes reviews, however I do feel let down by this organisation and can really relate to the numerous poor reviews attributed to this company. 
The customer service is disappointing. Numerous emails sent with no reply with a claim that they'll get back to you within 48 hrs. From experience thats not true.  Then a recommendation to call them which just leads to going straight to voicemail. 

Unfortunately I cannot recommend this organisation.

Update (14th oct): I've sent you my email

headline: Avoid QA for Apprenticeships
reviewBody:
Would recommend avoiding QA for Apprenticeships. Went through the full process with them, applied for a role, did multiple interviews and was told that I had the role.

Then weeks went by with no contact, I tried to contact both of the staff at QA dealing with the role no response via email and won't pick up the phone.

Contacted head office and they can't get me through to them either or talk about the position.

So I resorted to contacting the business who would have been taking me on as an apprentice who have also told me they had been cut off by QA.

This isn't just days or weeks of being cut off now it's been months.

headline: Would Recommend!
reviewBody: I had a great experience taking the Learn to Code- Using JavaScript course. The instructor was really helpful and patient. Normally I find remote learning a bit challenging, but it worked really well. Thank you

headline: Brilliant one day course
reviewBody: Had a fantastic one day course led by Dragoslav, there's only so much you can learn in one day but this introduction from QA gave me a great start has inspired me to continue my web development journey.

headline: Excellent Training Experience
reviewBody:
I have recently taken 2 course with QA - PRINCE2 Foundation & PRINCE2 Practitioner - both were completed online.
My trainer was excellent, he was extremely knowledgeable and able to deliver the course remotely with ease. Any questions that candidates had were addressed immediately and when further explanation was requested it was covered without fuss.
Managing a group of 20+ candidates remotely would be a challenge to most but our trainer was professional and controlled this with ease.
The booking process, pre-course material, delivery of text books and access to session was excellent. QA kept me informed and answered any queries that I raised promptly.
I would highly recommend completing training with them.

headline: Unprofessional
reviewBody:
Unprofessional teachers, worse training programme ever. They try to blackmail you by promising a job at the end of the apprenticeship programme but send you to a non IT company.

Slough Branch

headline: Avoid
reviewBody: They assign you a 'buddy' to assist you throughout the apprenticeship process but then they just abandon you and stop replying to emails. Avoid.

headline: Terrible workplace and mixed messages‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Terrible workplace and mixed messages about support available any references to this were only on the phone so nothing in writing.

headline: I have taken 2 courses with QA (P3O and‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I have taken 2 courses with QA (P3O and PRINCE2) both really enjoyable 1 week intense course (each). Instructors are easy to learn from and really helpful. 
Not a fan of their online test papers (which they are moving to permanently) as I had an instance where when I was taking my exam for P3O the page kept hanging on the server for a total of 20 mins!! Very off putting but once I explained what happened to the course leader and QA account manager they allowed me to resit for free where I had the choice to do paper exam. Much preferred!

headline: Good quality training - well worth the money and better than the competition!
reviewBody:
Good quality training - good trainers and well designed course materials. Value for Money!
I have completed multiple AXELOS Foundation & Practitioner courses with both QA and also alternative training providers and would highly recommend QA for choice. Overall my experience of their courses has been far superior to cheaper alternative companies offering the same courses. The trainers are both well experienced in the relevant field but also talented trainers who understand how to train a room full of individuals with differing experiences themselves and ways of Learning. The course materials are better structured, more comprehensive in covering the syllabus and better quality in this presentation.
The structure of the day and the week is well organised and admin around organising the actual exams is made as easy as possible with the exams being booked in advance to take place within the week of the course (unlike competitors who have moved away from this to drive down their own costs!).
Although QA has come with a higher price tag than other course providers - they are well worth the money as a cut above the alternatives in supporting you to achieve your course objectives.

headline: Appalling
reviewBody: I recently attended a 3 day BCS Foundation Certificate in Business Analyst provided by this company recently. Was appalled by anti Irish racist commentary and aggressive teaching style. Avoid this unprofessional training provider.
